snippet: The discount retailer, under pressure from the activist investor Carl C. Icahn to sell itself, said its profit fell by a third as competition intensified.
abstract: Discount retailer Family Dollar, under pressure from activist investor Carl Icahn to sell itself, says third-quarter profit fell 33 percent to $81.1 million, as competition intensified and company cleared inventory ahead of planned store closings; reports 3.3 percent increase in net sales, to $2.66 billion, slightly above analysts' estimates.
lead_paragraph: The discount retailer, under pressure from the activist investor Carl C. Icahn to sell itself, said its profit fell by a third as competition intensified.

headline.main: Family Dollar Posts Lower Profit, as Carl Icahn Presses for a Sale
headline.print_headline: Family Dollar Posts Lower Profit, as Carl Icahn Presses for a Sale
